body_html:
Started looking into the issue starting from the file tensorflow/core/kernels/sparse_matmul_op_test.cc
As per initial analysis found that following code returning incorrect results on ppc64le https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v1.0.1/tensorflow/core/kernels/sparse_matmul_op_test.cc#L255-L256

TEST_F(SparseMatmulOpTest, BroadcastPacketTest) {
  for (int i = 0; i < PacketSize; ++i) ref[i] = data1[0];
  internal::pstoreu(data2, internal::pbroadcast_first<Packet>(
                              internal::ploadu<Packet>(data1)));
   ASSERT_TRUE(areApprox(ref, data2, PacketSize));

Here we are getting incorrect results for data2 array ([ 0.170094 0.14922 -0.0823886 0.026985] VS expected [0.170094 0.170094 0.170094 0.170094]).
Currently I am investigating further on this.
